title: VR-Based Experiential Social Work Practice Education: Enhancing Relationship-Centered Practice Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social welfare theory and intermediate-level field experience
context.additional_context: Simulation-based learning utilizing 360Â° VR videos to recreate real child protection cases in smartphone-based, limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can apply relationship-centered practical skills with over 80% accuracy in 360-degree VR simulations.
Learners can analyze field cases and develop three or more relationship-based intervention strategies from a child-family systems perspective.
Learners can reflect on and document two emotional responses observed during practical sessions in a reflective journal via peer evaluation after VR experiences.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
